text.26_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: “Therefore, you are less than nothing (meh-ayin), your effect is less than nullity (meh-afah),
text.26_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: Rav Levi opened his discourse with the text from Isaiah (41:24):
text.26_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: Even though the infant emerges from the womb filthy and soiled, full of secretions and blood,
text.26_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: One who choose you is an abomination.”
text.26_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: Meh-afah means: from the one hundred cries (ma’ah pe’ayot) a woman utters when she gives birth, when it is a case of ninety nine chance of death and one of life…
text.26_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: all embrace and kiss it, especially so if it is a male.
text.26_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: Meh-ayin means: nothing at all, from a foul secretion.
